title: Please ID this type.
content:
Hello everyone!

This type looks like Trajan to me, but I ain’t getting a perfect match with it. Any other suggestions?

Thank you.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025043227im_/http:/typophile.com/files/greenwave_6394.jpg)

 [‹ Script typeface id](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025043227/http:/typophile.com/node/49383 "Go to previous forum topic") [fabrica de anisados y licores font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025043227/http:/typophile.com/node/49379 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Pedro Peixoto

comments.content:
Ray Larabie did his own take on the Trajan lettering and called it [Byington](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025043227/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/byington/). I think this might be Byington that has been widened. (Or it may be Trajan Bold that has been either widened or flattened.)

- Mike Yanega

Looking at the two typefaces, I am inclined to think the serifs on your sample look more like Trajan. Larabie says he beefed them up in his version, for video and lo-res applications, and I think that may be the difference.

- Mike Yanega
It looks like Trajan Bold to me...rather squashed though:(
It looks like Trajan Bold to me...rather squashed though:(
